title: United Airlines data stolen by hackers; suspected same ones that hacked OPM
text:
United Airlines data stolen by hackers; suspected same ones that hacked OPM Jul 29, 2015, 11:38am CDT Industries & Tags Ben Nelms | Bloomberg United Airlines was reportedly hacked by the same team that hacked the U.S. Office of… more The hackers who compromised the United States’ Office of Personnel Management earlier this year apparently also breached United Airlines’ systems. It’s not yet clear what information, precisely, the hackers took, but Bloomberg reported that the breach is sparking fears that the Chinese government -- suspected of sponsoring the intruders -- has now gathered a formidable set of information on Americans involved with defense and intelligence, from their security-clearance records, to medical records, and now to travel records. In all, this group of hackers could be connected to at least 10 companies and organizations, the report said. Bloomberg also described speculation that the Chinese-backed hackers’ activities could have been related to two ground stops United (NYSE: UAL) suffered in recent months, though the company indicated it has found no connection. Perhaps worst of all for United, the intruders weren’t just looking for passenger data. Bloomberg added that they may have also obtained corporate information about the company’s mergers and acquisitions strategy. It could be months before United and other investigators determine just how much information was stolen, Bloomberg said.
